content.question: In a comparison of a profit-maximizing perfectly competitive firm's short-run equilibrium to its long-run equilibrium, which of the following is true?

choices.label: Price must equal marginal cost in the long run, but not necessarily in the short run.
Economic profit must be positive in the long run, but not necessarily in the short run.
The firm can set price in the short run, but not necessarily in the long run.
The firm must produce at minimum average total cost in the short run, but not necessarily in the long run.
Price equals average total cost in the long run, but not necessarily in the short run.

content.answer: Price equals average total cost in the long run, but not necessarily in the short run.
